body:
Ok so lately people are saying that a member on the team PureDogs, was using an illegal client, usually called "autoclicker". The team was not disqualified, and will go on to the qualifiers. 
No offense to the officials and stuff, but im pretty sure you can't go against your own rule
cough cough http://imgur.com/WkgKySs cough cough. 

So to make it clear,

if they are not dq'ed, i see no reason why all the other teams cant just autoclick their way to the finish, not like they don't already.....
 
In my frowned upon opinion, we should cast a vote. https://goo.gl/p5Y3kD k here's a poll


Downloading my autocliker for t6,
 
-rattle

replies.body:
What a great tournament this has been? The refs that wouldn't shut up when we were playing our game, the games that were over 30 minutes delayed, screen shares that went for more than 2 hours, getting demoted if you didn't stream, and now this. I don't get what the officials are doing with this tournament. I have nothing against them but come on, this is the most fucked up decision ever. If you are going to make a fucking rule you HAVE to obey it. Honestly, what the fuck is this official team doing? Please get new officials. this is just disappointing.

Good job Ryan, you predicted correctly. This is probably 1 of the worst tournaments.

Why did this get removed Kyoal? It is honest feedback.

replies.body: I'm hoping that this doesn't turn into yet another Avicus forums flame war but I have to agree. I have nothing against PureDogs and I'd like to think I'm friends with some of the members but, to me, rules are rules. I realise and understand how to decision to not disqualify PureDogs came about but I don't particularly agree with it. I'm not doing this as a last-ditch attempt to get back into the tournament because if I'm perfectly honest it's not terribly important to me. I just want to stress the fact that this is going to change the reputation of the Offical team, making it worse than it already is. Again, I have nothing against the staff team and I realise they do their best to create the best competitive atmosphere possible and I respect them for that but the fact of the matter is, I feel that people are going to see this as an opportunity to cheat. If they're caught cheating they are undoubtedly going to argue "PureDogs weren't disqualified when Zaoki was caught so why should we be dq'd". There is most likely more to this than I know but this is what I gathered from the whole situation. Obviously this post is not going to change a thing but I'd like to hear others' opinions on this without people flaming. Sorry for the rant and fair play if you read all this.
replies.body_tagged: I'm hoping that this doesn't turn into yet another Avicus forums flame war but I have to agree. I have nothing against PureDogs and I'd like to think I'm friends with some of the members but, to me, rules are rules. I realise and understand how to decision to not disqualify PureDogs came about but I don't particularly agree with it. I'm not doing this as a last-ditch attempt to get back into the tournament because if I'm perfectly honest it's not terribly important to me. I just want to stress the fact that this is going to change the reputation of the Offical team, making it worse than it already is. Again, I have nothing against the staff team and I realise they do their best to create the best competitive atmosphere possible and I respect them for that but the fact of the matter is, I feel that people are going to see this as an opportunity to cheat. If they're caught cheating they are undoubtedly going to argue "PureDogs weren't disqualified when Zaoki was caught so why should we be dq'd". There is most likely more to this than I know but this is what I gathered from the whole situation. Obviously this post is not going to change a thing but I'd like to hear others' opinions on this without people flaming. Sorry for the rant and fair play if you read all this.

replies.body:
Why is there even need for a discussion over this, this is honestly the most black and white rule that was set for this tourney. How are they not dq'ed? Officials? Hello?

To be fair, I know your official team consists of people who play for their team whilst 2 teams are delayed for 40 minutes to be allocated an official server and refs before said official realises "Oh shit, i forgot I should do my job" (I won't mentions Tomqss name because he would and should be fucking embarrassed) Putting that aside, I think you can manage this relatively easy problem.

My question is why did this take you 2 and a half hours to find an autoclicker? Nice screenshare - I think thats a problem as well.

I'm not claiming to be the best official in history, but the official team has slipped since I've been gone, pick up your fucking act please. This is honestly the easiest rule to enforce, this isn't a thing where there are 2 sides of the debate, you're own fucking rules are so clear on this - there is no counter argument to this.

replies.body:
The Avicus Official Staff Team is the most unorganised, unreliable, most biased, most fickle lot of people you could possibly manage to promote. They make my 4 year old brother look clever. Just by there sheer stupidity. I have not once witnessed a more idiotic act of favouritism. Im starting to worry, not just for the teams that face the potential cheaters but for the whole community if senior mods and mods could over look a rule like that. Considering the official team has mods plus on it.  Who evens makes a clear rule, which makes the community abide and believe in, then turns around and says 'we are making an exception' How should the potential team to take there place feel. How should the teams feel knowing exceptions are being made for the higher tier teams.


Not saying this to every official, just the ones who voted to go against there OWN rule. Which was set in stone.

Also not saying i could do much better but if your going to do a job, do it properly.

reply_to.body:
What a great tournament this has been? The refs that wouldn't shut up when we were playing our game, the games that were over 30 minutes delayed, screen shares that went for more than 2 hours, getting demoted if you didn't stream, and now this. I don't get what the officials are doing with this tournament. I have nothing against them but come on, this is the most fucked up decision ever. If you are going to make a fucking rule you HAVE to obey it. Honestly, what the fuck is this official team doing? Please get new officials. this is just disappointing.

Good job Ryan, you predicted correctly. This is probably 1 of the worst tournaments.

Why did this get removed Kyoal? It is honest feedback.

reply_to.body: I'm hoping that this doesn't turn into yet another Avicus forums flame war but I have to agree. I have nothing against PureDogs and I'd like to think I'm friends with some of the members but, to me, rules are rules. I realise and understand how to decision to not disqualify PureDogs came about but I don't particularly agree with it. I'm not doing this as a last-ditch attempt to get back into the tournament because if I'm perfectly honest it's not terribly important to me. I just want to stress the fact that this is going to change the reputation of the Offical team, making it worse than it already is. Again, I have nothing against the staff team and I realise they do their best to create the best competitive atmosphere possible and I respect them for that but the fact of the matter is, I feel that people are going to see this as an opportunity to cheat. If they're caught cheating they are undoubtedly going to argue "PureDogs weren't disqualified when Zaoki was caught so why should we be dq'd". There is most likely more to this than I know but this is what I gathered from the whole situation. Obviously this post is not going to change a thing but I'd like to hear others' opinions on this without people flaming. Sorry for the rant and fair play if you read all this.
reply_to.body_tagged: I'm hoping that this doesn't turn into yet another Avicus forums flame war but I have to agree. I have nothing against PureDogs and I'd like to think I'm friends with some of the members but, to me, rules are rules. I realise and understand how to decision to not disqualify PureDogs came about but I don't particularly agree with it. I'm not doing this as a last-ditch attempt to get back into the tournament because if I'm perfectly honest it's not terribly important to me. I just want to stress the fact that this is going to change the reputation of the Offical team, making it worse than it already is. Again, I have nothing against the staff team and I realise they do their best to create the best competitive atmosphere possible and I respect them for that but the fact of the matter is, I feel that people are going to see this as an opportunity to cheat. If they're caught cheating they are undoubtedly going to argue "PureDogs weren't disqualified when Zaoki was caught so why should we be dq'd". There is most likely more to this than I know but this is what I gathered from the whole situation. Obviously this post is not going to change a thing but I'd like to hear others' opinions on this without people flaming. Sorry for the rant and fair play if you read all this.
